lines.content: * A possible command that can be executed by Zenerbot.
* Each command can expect parameters, but the base command is not case-sensitive.
System.out.println("Goodbye! It was a nice chat! :)");
System.out.println("No tasks today. Take a break!");
/** mark: mark a task as done */
System.out.println("Good work. This task is done:");
/** unmark: mark a task as not done */
System.out.println("I will mark this as undone for now:");
/** todo: create a new todo task */
System.out.println("I have created a new task for you:");
System.out.println("There are now " + tasks.size() + " task(s) to be done.");
/** deadline: create a new deadline task */

System.out.println("I have created a new task for you:");
System.out.println("There are now " + tasks.size() + " task(s) to be done.");
/** event: create a new event task */
if (f == -1 || f == params.length - 1 || t == -1 || t == params.length - 1 || t - f <= 1) {
String from = String.join(" ", Arrays.copyOfRange(params, f + 1, t));
String to = String.join(" ", Arrays.copyOfRange(params, t + 1, params.length));
Event event = new Event(name, from, to);
System.out.println("I have created a new task for you:");

* Gets a command based on a string (non-case-sensitive).
* Executes the defined behaviour of the command.
abstract void execute(Zenerbot bot, String[] params);
/** Deadline tasks have a date/time associated to it. */
* @param name The name of the task
* @param by The datetime when the task is due (as string)
/** Event tasks start at a specific datetime and ends at a specific date/time. */
* @param name The name of the task
* @param from The datetime when the event starts
* @param to The datetime when the event ends
public Event(String name, String from, String to) {
* Thrown when the task is invalid or is missing required parameters.
Task was not setup properly! Ensure the parameters are correct!\s
* A task created by the user.
* The task is set as undone initially.
* @param name The name of the task
/** ToDo tasks do not have any date/time attached to it */
* @param name The name of the task
* Thrown when command is not known by the bot.
this.message = "Unknown command! Did you spell it wrongly?";
/** The singleton instance of the bot */
private final ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Gets the singleton instance of the bot.
/** Starts and runs the bot loop. */
System.out.println("Hello there! I am ZenerBot, your personal assistant.");

SET /P replace="Replace expected output with current actual? (y/n) "
